properties.description: The name of the Row.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The index of the Row within its containing object.
properties.name: index

properties.description: The number of rows that the object spans.
properties.name: rowSpan

properties.description: The number of columns that the object spans.
properties.name: columnSpan

properties.description: If true, the story has overset text.
properties.name: overflows

properties.description: The parent row of the cell.
properties.name: parentRow

properties.description: The parent column of the cell.
properties.name: parentColumn

properties.description: Returns true if the object specifier resolves to valid objects.
properties.name: isValid

properties.description: The parent of the Row (a Table).
properties.name: parent

properties.description: A collection of table cells.
properties.name: cells

properties.description: A collection of table rows.
properties.name: rows

properties.description: A collection of table columns.
properties.name: columns

properties.description: A collection of events.
properties.name: events

properties.description: A collection of event listeners.
properties.name: eventListeners

properties.description: The height of the Row. For a table or column, specifies the sum of the row heights.
properties.name: height

properties.description: The width of the Row. For a table or row, specifies the sum of the column widths.
properties.name: width

properties.description: The text contents. For rows or columns, when specified as a string, the sting populates each cell in the row or column; when specified as an array, the first value in the array populates the left-most cell in the row or the top-most cell in the column; the next value populates the next cell to the right (for rows) or the next lowest cell (for columns), and so on. Can return: String, SpecialCharacters enumerator or Array of Strings or SpecialCharacters enumerators. Can also accept: NothingEnum enumerator or Array of Strings, SpecialCharacters enumerators or NothingEnum enumerators.
properties.name: contents

properties.description: The length (of a linear gradient) or radius (of a radial gradient) applied to the fill of the object.
properties.name: gradientFillLength

properties.description: The angle of a linear gradient applied to the fill of the object. (Range: -180 to 180)
properties.name: gradientFillAngle

properties.description: The starting point (in page coordinates) of a gradient applied to the fill of the Row, in the format [x, y].
properties.name: gradientFillStart

properties.description: The top inset of the cell.
properties.name: topInset

properties.description: The left inset of the cell.
properties.name: leftInset

properties.description: The bottom inset of the cell.
properties.name: bottomInset

properties.description: The right inset of the cell.
properties.name: rightInset

properties.description: The swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the fill of the object. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: fillColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the fill of the object.
properties.name: fillTint

properties.description: If true, the fill of the object will overprint.
properties.name: overprintFill

properties.description: If true, draws a diagonal line starting from the top left.
properties.name: topLeftDiagonalLine

properties.description: If true, draws a diagonal line starting from the top right.
properties.name: topRightDiagonalLine

properties.description: If true, draws the diagonal line in front of cell contents.
properties.name: diagonalLineInFront

properties.description: The diagonal line stroke weight.
properties.name: diagonalLineStrokeWeight

properties.description: The stroke type of the diagonal line(s). Can also accept: String.
properties.name: diagonalLineStrokeType

properties.description: The diagonal line color, specified as a swatch.
properties.name: diagonalLineStrokeColor

properties.description: The diagonal line tint (as a percentage). (Range: 0 to 100)
properties.name: diagonalLineStrokeTint

properties.description: If true, the diagonal line stroke will overprint.
properties.name: diagonalLineStrokeOverprint

properties.description: The swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the gap of the diagonal line stroke. Note: Not valid when diagonal line stroke type is solid.
properties.name: diagonalLineStrokeGapColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the diagonal line stroke gap color. Note: Not valid when diagonal line stroke type is solid.
properties.name: diagonalLineStrokeGapTint

properties.description: If true, the stroke gap of the diagonal line will overprint. Note: Not valid when diagonal line stroke type is solid.
properties.name: diagonalLineStrokeGapOverprint

properties.description: If true, clips the cell's content to width and height of the cell.
properties.name: clipContentToCell

properties.description: The distance between the baseline of the text and the top inset of the cell.
properties.name: firstBaselineOffset

properties.description: The vertical alignment of cell.
properties.name: verticalJustification

properties.description: The maximum space that can be added between paragraphs in a cell. Note: Valid only when vertical justification is justified.
properties.name: paragraphSpacingLimit

properties.description: The space between the baseline of the text and the top inset of the frame or cell.
properties.name: minimumFirstBaselineOffset

properties.description: The rotation angle (in degrees) of the cell, specified as one of the following values: 0, 90, 180, or 270.
properties.name: rotationAngle

properties.description: The stroke weight of the left edge border stroke.
properties.name: leftEdgeStrokeWeight

properties.description: The stroke type of the left edge. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: leftEdgeStrokeType

properties.description: The swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the left edge border stroke.
properties.name: leftEdgeStrokeColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the left edge border stroke. (Range: 0 to 100)
properties.name: leftEdgeStrokeTint

properties.description: If true, the left edge border stroke will overprint.
properties.name: leftEdgeStrokeOverprint

properties.description: The swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the gap of the left edge border stroke. Note: Not valid when left edge stroke type is solid.
properties.name: leftEdgeStrokeGapColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the left edge border stroke gap color. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Not valid when left edge stroke type is solid.
properties.name: leftEdgeStrokeGapTint

properties.description: If true, the gap color of the left edge border stroke will overprint. Note: Not valid when left edge stroke type is solid.
properties.name: leftEdgeStrokeGapOverprint

properties.description: The stroke weight of the top edge border stroke.
properties.name: topEdgeStrokeWeight

properties.description: The stroke type of the top edge. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: topEdgeStrokeType

properties.description: The swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the top edge border stroke.
properties.name: topEdgeStrokeColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the top edge border stroke. (Range: 0 to 100)
properties.name: topEdgeStrokeTint

properties.description: If true, the top edge border stroke will overprint.
properties.name: topEdgeStrokeOverprint

properties.description: The swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the gap of the top edge border stroke. Note: Not valid when top edge stroke type is solid.
properties.name: topEdgeStrokeGapColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the top edge border stroke gap color. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Not valid when top edge stroke type is solid.
properties.name: topEdgeStrokeGapTint

properties.description: If true, the gap color of the top edge border stroke will overprint. Note: Not valid when top edge stroke type is solid.
properties.name: topEdgeStrokeGapOverprint

properties.description: The stroke weight of the right edge border stroke.
properties.name: rightEdgeStrokeWeight

properties.description: The stroke type of the right edge. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: rightEdgeStrokeType

properties.description: The color, specified as a swatch, of the right edge border stroke.
properties.name: rightEdgeStrokeColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the right edge border stroke. (Range: 0 to 100)
properties.name: rightEdgeStrokeTint

properties.description: If true, the right edge border stroke will overprint.
properties.name: rightEdgeStrokeOverprint

properties.description: The swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the gap of the right edge border stroke. Note: Not valid when right edge stroke type is solid.
properties.name: rightEdgeStrokeGapColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the right edge border stroke gap color. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Not valid when right edge stroke type is solid.
properties.name: rightEdgeStrokeGapTint

properties.description: If true, the gap color of the right edge border stroke will overprint. Note: Not valid when right edge stroke type is solid.
properties.name: rightEdgeStrokeGapOverprint

properties.name: bottomEdgeStrokeWeight

properties.description: The stroke type of the bottom edge. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: bottomEdgeStrokeType

properties.description: The swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the bottom edge border stroke.
properties.name: bottomEdgeStrokeColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the bottom edge border stroke.
properties.name: bottomEdgeStrokeTint

properties.description: If true, the bottom edge border stroke will overprint.
properties.name: bottomEdgeStrokeOverprint

properties.description: The swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the gap of the bottom edge border stroke. Note: Not valid when bottom edge stroke type is solid.
properties.name: bottomEdgeStrokeGapColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the bottom edge border stroke gap color. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Not valid when bottom edge stroke type is solid.
properties.name: bottomEdgeStrokeGapTint

properties.description: If true, the gap color of the bottom edge border stroke will overprint. Note: Not valid when bottom edge stroke type is solid.
properties.name: bottomEdgeStrokeGapOverprint

properties.description: The stroke weight of the inner row border strokes.
properties.name: innerRowStrokeWeight

properties.description: The stroke type of the inner row. Can also accept: String.
properties.name: innerRowStrokeType

properties.description: The color, specified as a swatch, of the inner row border stroke.
properties.name: innerRowStrokeColor

properties.description: The tint (as a percentage) of the inner row border stroke. (Range: 0 to 100)
properties.name: innerRowStrokeTint

properties.description: If true, the inner row border stroke will overprint.
properties.name: innerRowStrokeOverprint

properties.description: The swatch (color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the gap of the inner row border stroke. Note: Not valid when inner row stroke type is solid.
properties.name: innerRowStrokeGapColor

properties.description: If true, the gap color of the inner row border stroke will overprint. Note: Not valid when inner row stroke type is solid.

properties.name: innerColumnStrokeGapColor

properties.name: innerColumnStrokeGapTint

properties.description: If true, the gap color of the inner column border stroke will overprint. Note: Not valid when inner column stroke type is solid.
properties.name: innerColumnStrokeGapOverprint

properties.description: The minimum height of the cells in the Row. Note: When auto grow is true, cells can automatically grow larger than this amount when content is added. Also, the minimum height can affect redistribution.
properties.name: minimumHeight

properties.description: The maximum height to which cells in the Row may grow. Note: The maximum height cannot be exceeded even when auto grow is set to true. Also, the maximum height can affect redistribution.
properties.name: maximumHeight

properties.description: If true, keeps the row with the next row when the table is split across text frames or pages.
properties.name: keepWithNextRow

properties.description: Indicates where to start the row.
properties.name: startRow

properties.description: If true, the height of the cell or the cells in the Row can increase or decrease automatically to fit cell content. Note: Allows cells to grow or shrink to the maximum or minimum height, if specified.
properties.name: autoGrow

properties.description: The row type.
properties.name: rowType

properties.description: The direction of the text in the cell.
properties.name: writingDirection

properties.description: A property that allows setting of several properties at the same time.
properties.name: properties

methods.description: Recomposes the text in the Row.
methods.name: recompose

methods.description: Finds text that matches the find what value.

parameters.description: If true, returns the results in reverse order. (Optional)
parameters.name: reverseOrder

methods.name: findText

methods.description: Finds text that matches the find what value and replaces the text with the change to value.

parameters.description: If true, returns the results in reverse order. (Optional)
parameters.name: reverseOrder

methods.name: changeText

methods.description: Finds text that matches the find what value.

parameters.description: If true, returns the results in reverse order. (Optional)
parameters.name: reverseOrder

methods.name: findGrep

methods.description: Finds text that matches the find what value and replaces the text with the change to value.

parameters.description: If true, returns the results in reverse order. (Optional)
parameters.name: reverseOrder

methods.name: changeGrep

methods.description: Finds glyphs that match the find what value.

parameters.description: If true, returns the results in reverse order. (Optional)
parameters.name: reverseOrder

methods.name: findGlyph

methods.description: Finds glyphs that match the find what value and replaces the glyphs with the change to value.

parameters.description: If true, returns the results in reverse order. (Optional)
parameters.name: reverseOrder

methods.name: changeGlyph

methods.description: Finds text that matches the find character type value.

parameters.description: If true, returns the results in reverse order. (Optional)
parameters.name: reverseOrder

methods.name: findTransliterate

methods.description: Finds text that matches the find character type value and replaces the text with the change character type value.

parameters.description: If true, returns the results in reverse order. (Optional)
parameters.name: reverseOrder

methods.name: changeTransliterate

methods.description: Deletes the Row.
methods.name: remove

methods.description: Merges the cells.

parameters.description: The cell(s) to merge with. Can accept: Cell, Row or Column. (Optional)
parameters.name: with

methods.name: merge

methods.description: Unmerges all merged cells in the Row.
methods.name: unmerge

methods.description: Splits the cell along the specified axis.

parameters.description: The direction in which to split the cell.
parameters.name: using

methods.name: split

methods.description: Redistributes the specified range of Rows so that the Rows have a uniform size. Note: The maximum or minimum height or width specified for some of the cells in the range may prevent them from being exactly even.

parameters.description: The direction in which to redistribute.
parameters.name: using

parameters.description: The last Row in the range. Can accept: Cell, Column or Row. (Optional)
parameters.name: thru

methods.name: redistribute

methods.description: Selects the object.

parameters.name: existingSelection
parameters.description: The selection status of the Row in relation to previously selected objects. (Optional)

methods.name: select

methods.description: Converts text to outlines. Each line of text becomes a polygon object. When the converted text is a single letter that has no internal spaces or detached parts, the polygon contains only a single path. Note: To determine whether a font allows the creation of outlines, see allow outlines.

parameters.name: deleteOriginal
parameters.description: If true, deletes the original text. If false, creates the outlines as separate object(s) on top of the text.  (Optional)

methods.name: createOutlines

methods.description: Generates a string which, if executed, will return the Row.
methods.name: toSource

methods.description: Resolves the object specifier, creating an array of object references.
methods.name: getElements

methods.description: Retrieves the object specifier.
methods.name: toSpecifier

methods.description: Adds an event listener.

parameters.description: The event type.
parameters.name: eventType

parameters.description: The event handler. Can accept: File or JavaScript Function.
parameters.name: handler
captures
parameters.description: This parameter is obsolete. (Optional)

methods.name: addEventListener

methods.description: Removes the event listener.

parameters.description: The registered event type.
parameters.name: eventType

parameters.description: The registered event handler. Can accept: File or JavaScript Function.
parameters.name: handler
captures
parameters.description: This parameter is obsolete. (Optional)

methods.name: removeEventListener
